alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 17 at 7:20PM EST until January 20 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph and cause blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Southeast Webster, Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 PM EST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
